trans-unit.source: powershell,cmdlet

trans-unit.source: Starting Windows PowerShell on Earlier Versions of Windows
trans-unit.target: Starting Windows PowerShell on Earlier Versions of Windows

trans-unit.source: This section explains how to start Windows PowerShell and Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) on WindowsÂ® 7, Windows ServerÂ® 2008 R2, and Windows Server 2008.
trans-unit.target: This section explains how to start Windows PowerShell and Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) on WindowsÂ® 7, Windows ServerÂ® 2008 R2, and Windows Server 2008.

trans-unit.source: It also explains how to enable the optional feature for Windows PowerShell ISE in Windows PowerShell 2.0 on Windows ServerÂ® 2008 R2 and Windows Server 2008.
trans-unit.target: It also explains how to enable the optional feature for Windows PowerShell ISE in Windows PowerShell 2.0 on Windows ServerÂ® 2008 R2 and Windows Server 2008.

trans-unit.source: To install Windows PowerShell 4.0 on supported systems, download and install [Windows Management Framework 4.0](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=293881).
trans-unit.target: To install Windows PowerShell 4.0 on supported systems, download and install [Windows Management Framework 4.0](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=293881).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Installing Windows PowerShell](Installing-Windows-PowerShell.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Installing Windows PowerShell](Installing-Windows-PowerShell.md).

trans-unit.source: To install Windows PowerShell 3.0 on supported systems, download and install [Windows Management Framework 3.0](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=240290).
trans-unit.target: To install Windows PowerShell 3.0 on supported systems, download and install [Windows Management Framework 3.0](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=240290).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Installing Windows PowerShell](Installing-Windows-PowerShell.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Installing Windows PowerShell](Installing-Windows-PowerShell.md).

trans-unit.source: How to Start Windows PowerShell on Earlier Versions of Windows
trans-unit.target: How to Start Windows PowerShell on Earlier Versions of Windows

trans-unit.source: Use any of the following methods to start the installed version of Windows PowerShell 3.0, or Windows PowerShell 4.0, where applicable.
trans-unit.target: Use any of the following methods to start the installed version of Windows PowerShell 3.0, or Windows PowerShell 4.0, where applicable.

trans-unit.source: From the Start Menu
trans-unit.target: From the Start Menu

trans-unit.source: Click **Start**, type **PowerShell**, and then click **Windows PowerShell**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Start**, type **PowerShell**, and then click **Windows PowerShell**.

trans-unit.source: From the **Start** menu, click **Start**, click **All Programs**, click **Accessories**, click the **Windows PowerShell** folder, and then click **Windows PowerShell**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Start** menu, click **Start**, click **All Programs**, click **Accessories**, click the **Windows PowerShell** folder, and then click **Windows PowerShell**.

trans-unit.source: At the Command Prompt
trans-unit.target: At the Command Prompt

trans-unit.source: In Cmd.exe, Windows PowerShell, or Windows PowerShell ISE, to start Windows PowerShell, type:
trans-unit.target: In Cmd.exe, Windows PowerShell, or Windows PowerShell ISE, to start Windows PowerShell, type:

trans-unit.source: You can also use the parameters of the PowerShell.exe program to customize the session.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the parameters of the PowerShell.exe program to customize the session.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [PowerShell.exe Command-Line Help](../core-powershell/console/PowerShell.exe-Command-Line-Help.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [PowerShell.exe Command-Line Help](../core-powershell/console/PowerShell.exe-Command-Line-Help.md).

trans-unit.source: With Administrative privileges ("Run as administrator")
trans-unit.target: With Administrative privileges ("Run as administrator")

trans-unit.source: Click **Start**, type **PowerShell**, right-click **Windows PowerShell**, and then click **Run as administrator**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Start**, type **PowerShell**, right-click **Windows PowerShell**, and then click **Run as administrator**.

trans-unit.source: How to Start Windows PowerShell ISE on Earlier Releases of Windows
trans-unit.target: How to Start Windows PowerShell ISE on Earlier Releases of Windows

trans-unit.source: Use any of the following methods to start Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: Use any of the following methods to start Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: From the Start Menu
trans-unit.target: From the Start Menu

trans-unit.source: Click **Start**, type **ISE**, and then click **Windows PowerShell ISE**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Start**, type **ISE**, and then click **Windows PowerShell ISE**.

trans-unit.source: From the **Start** menu, click **Start**, click **All Programs**, click **Accessories**, click the **Windows PowerShell** folder, and then click **Windows PowerShell ISE**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Start** menu, click **Start**, click **All Programs**, click **Accessories**, click the **Windows PowerShell** folder, and then click **Windows PowerShell ISE**.

trans-unit.source: At the Command Prompt
trans-unit.target: At the Command Prompt

trans-unit.source: In Cmd.exe, Windows PowerShell, or Windows PowerShell ISE, to start Windows PowerShell, type:
trans-unit.target: In Cmd.exe, Windows PowerShell, or Windows PowerShell ISE, to start Windows PowerShell, type:

trans-unit.source: or
trans-unit.target: or

trans-unit.source: With Administrative privileges ("Run as administrator")
trans-unit.target: With Administrative privileges ("Run as administrator")

trans-unit.source: Click **Start**, type **ISE**, right-click **Windows PowerShell ISE**, and then click **Run as administrator**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Start**, type **ISE**, right-click **Windows PowerShell ISE**, and then click **Run as administrator**.

trans-unit.source: How to Enable Windows PowerShell ISE on Earlier Releases of Windows
trans-unit.target: How to Enable Windows PowerShell ISE on Earlier Releases of Windows

trans-unit.source: In Windows PowerShell 4.0 and Windows PowerShell 3.0, Windows PowerShell ISE is enabled by default on all versions of Windows.
trans-unit.target: In Windows PowerShell 4.0 and Windows PowerShell 3.0, Windows PowerShell ISE is enabled by default on all versions of Windows.

trans-unit.source: If it is not already enabled, Windows Management Framework 4.0 or Windows Management Framework 3.0 enables it.
trans-unit.target: If it is not already enabled, Windows Management Framework 4.0 or Windows Management Framework 3.0 enables it.

trans-unit.source: In Windows PowerShell 2.0, Windows PowerShell ISE is enabled by default on Windows 7.
trans-unit.target: In Windows PowerShell 2.0, Windows PowerShell ISE is enabled by default on Windows 7.

trans-unit.source: However, on Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows Server 2008, it is an optional feature.
trans-unit.target: However, on Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows Server 2008, it is an optional feature.

trans-unit.source: To enable Windows PowerShell ISE in Windows PowerShell 2.0 on Windows Server 2008 R2 or Windows Server 2008, use the following procedure.
trans-unit.target: To enable Windows PowerShell ISE in Windows PowerShell 2.0 on Windows Server 2008 R2 or Windows Server 2008, use the following procedure.

trans-unit.source: To enable Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE)
trans-unit.target: To enable Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE)

trans-unit.source: Start Server Manager.
trans-unit.target: Start Server Manager.

trans-unit.source: Click **Features** and then click **Add Features**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Features** and then click **Add Features**.

trans-unit.source: In Select Features, click Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE).
trans-unit.target: In Select Features, click Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE).
